summary: Is the federal government monitoring its foreign aid funds? The United States plans to spend more than $34 billion on foreign assistance in 2017 to improve health, support democracy, and achieve other U.S. foreign policy goals. To effectively manage these funds, the government needs reliable ways to monitor and evaluate how this money is spent. We reviewed 6 federal agencies' policies for monitoring and evaluating...
title: Foreign Assistance: Selected Agencies' Monitoring and Evaluation Policies Generally Address Leading Practices
